messageBody:
Arnaud,

That sounds like an excellent feature request. Can you add it to
SourceForge? Thanks,

David Saff

On Mon, Jan 12, 2009 at 8:17 AM, Arnaud Bailly <arnaud.oqube@...>wrote:

> Hello,
> Following this list's advices, I have rewritten my forme JUnit3 tests
> using JUnit 4. What I did was creating a subclass of Paramaterized
> with a special annotation and a method load() that actually runs the
> HtmlUnit tests, constructs the results and returns a collection of
> JQTest that can later be used as parameters with Parameterized
> annotaion.
>
> The abridged runner code is:
>
> public class JQUnitRunner extends Parameterized {
>
> private static String testPagePath;
>
> @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
> public static @interface Page {
>
> String value();
>
> }
>
> public JQUnitRunner(Class<?> clazz) throws Exception {
> super(clazz);
> }
>
> public static class JQTest { ... }
>
> private static HtmlUnitDriver driver;
> private static final String basedir = System.getProperty("basedir", ".");
>
> public static List<JQTest[]> load(Class<?> clazz) { ... }
>
> }
>
> It is used by test class instances using the following idiom:
>
> @RunWith(JQUnitRunner.class)
> @...("test-etatflash")
> public class EtatFlashTest {
>
> private JQTest jqTest;
>
> @Parameters
> public static Collection<JQTest[]> jqtests() {
> return JQUnitRunner.load(EtatFlashTest.class);
> }
>
> public EtatFlashTest(JQTest test) {
> this.jqTest = test;
> }
>
> @Test
> public void test() {
> jqTest.assertPass();
> }
> }
>
> I am not entirely satisfied with this, as there is still boilerplate
> code in the test classes. I would have liked to override the following
> method from Parameterized but it is private:
>
> private List<Object[]> getParametersList(TestClass klass)
>
> Overriding would have allowed to remove entirely the jqtests method
> from test classes.
>
> regards
>
> Arnaud Bailly
